storyInfo: By chance, Carnelian witnesses an Infected girl being hunted as she leaves a noble's manor. When she learns of the runaway's predicament, she decides to give the girl a helping hand.

attributes.content: Please wait here for a moment. We'll have someone bring you the contract.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: All the fine points of this collaboration are detailed in here. Please bring it back and have the Count read it over.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: If you have any other questions, please feel free to ask... Miss Carnelian? Are you listening?
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Oh... Sorry, I spaced out a little.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: So, as I was saying, do you have any questions about this collaboration?
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Not for the moment. I will bring this back to Count Hohenlohe so that he may make his decision.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Wonderful. I look forward to the Count arriving at a decision that will benefit us both.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Are you leaving already? If you have no other plans, Sir Feuerbach told me to accompany...
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: You needn't worry. Do let Sir Feuerbach know how thankful I am for his generosity.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Since I am here, I will take a stroll around the city to see the sights.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Ah, would you like a guide, then? I can arrange for one right away.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Please don't worry yourself. I will just be strolling about.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Oh, this reminds me... I visited before when I represented the Count on our last collaboration. I believe that was before the Empresses' last banquet?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Precisely.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: If I remember correctly, this place was filled with the horns of other species as decorations. Are we trying out new style?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Hmm, take this ornament for example. You don't see its quality and lustrousness every day. If I have to guess, they must be made from Solidified Origincrystals.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: That is correct.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Miss Carnelian, I must say, you have a good eye, and far more so than before.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: You flatter me.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: As far as I know, stable crystals such as these can only be mined in the deepest parts of Originium veins, and most of them are buried inside the Originium itself. That makes them extraordinarily rare.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: And these crystals are far harder than stone. Normal carving processes cannot so much as make a dent on them.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Considering the difficulty of the process, I suppose it must have taken Sir Feuerbach some effort to amass such a massive collection of fine decorations?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: It's not actually that difficult. Master Feuerbach found this collection of Originium art pieces by coincidence when he diligently inspected his territory.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: He thought that their black luster is full of appeal and mystique, making them prime for viewing, and so he had us place them here so that they may be appreciated by all our visitors.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: In that case, I guess we should raise a glass to his generosity.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Miss Carnelian, you seem to be familiar with the subject.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: I can't say I'm familiar with them... Though... Hm... I've seen how these are produced before, so it does stir my emotions a little.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Take a look at this. For just a small chunk of Origincrystal like this, you must dig several hundreds, if not thousands of meters deep. If you lose your footing on your way down, you will most certainly die.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I heard the mining sites in this territory have had quite a few accidents of late? It's such a small trinket, but the amount of blood spilled for its mining could perhaps fill the knight's bathtub.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Miss Carnelian, I believe you are mistaken...
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: For most, these items are indeed difficult to obtain, but they are merely seasonal decorations for Sir Feuerbach.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Such considerations simply do not matter to him.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Whatever his wish is, all he has to do is give the order. That is why we stand here.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Heh...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Do you perhaps see it differently?
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: I'm afraid you wouldn't want to know how I see it.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: With all due respect, Miss Carnelian... You are indebted to the Count's kindness.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Hm.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: The world was shocked when, two years ago, we found an outsider whom none of us have heard of serving the then-underage Count Hohenlohe as his attendant. This has never happened before.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: You should be more careful and consider the Count's position and reputation before you act.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: It sounds like you're not very fond with the way I do things.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: And before you deny it, I've actually met plenty of people who antagonize me as well as those who see the Count as an outsider among the nobles.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: So, am I more or less on point?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: It is no simple task to have the entire Leithanien be so accepting of an outsider.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: But you don't seem to mind those rumors at all. Certainly, you are no less talented than what the rumors suggest. You are bold as well. Anything I say can only hold you in high esteem.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Hah, you certainly have a way with words, but I will take that as a compliment.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: As for the accident that occurred at the mines... You needn't worry. Our guards and Casters are already on the case.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: You are right. We indeed need to be more careful given the situation. This accident will be dealt with accordingly. No one will be able to use it against the Count.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Oh, you think that's what I'm worried about?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Okay, let's say that's how it is, then. Though, as far as I know, the way you deal with things accordingly isn't generally very peaceful.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: We're merely ridding our blankets of dust.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Oh, so you're saying taking out everyone involved is a way of solving problems?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: It looks like I'm overstaying my welcome. Please excuse me.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Before I go, let me remind you that while Sir Feuerbach is free to ignore the sick in his territory, the Empresses are no gentle little lambs. Looking down on them will not serve you well.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Oh, no no. You must be mistaken, Miss Carnelian, we have never looked down upon the Empresses.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: The Empresses need authority. They need a stronger, authoritative rule. They want to be obeyed, not followed. They have already turned their attention toward us and made the time to deal with us.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Understandable. All rulers eventually walk down this path.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: It's hardly a surprise. We are very familiar with how each other think.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Looks like you are pretty confident.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: You are fearful because you haven't experienced Leithanien's past, Miss Carnelian.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: The Empresses, whether the golden or the black, simply do not compare to the shadows that once shrouded Leithanien.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: And that is despite the fact it was them who overthrew those shadows.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: You are saying...?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I lived through that era myself. The red crystals hung high above the towers became a symbol of terror that parents would use it to force their children to behave.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: The Witch King...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: We don't speak that name these days.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Indeed, I seldom hear of anything on the subject, only some rumors here and there. I heard the legend that a red glow illuminating the entire night sky and how it could be seen all across Leithanien.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: The older generation seems to never have forgotten this, yet they are always mum on the subject.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: This is normal... Aside from trust, fear is also an effective way to silence men.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: I witnessed that sea of red too... And on the second day, the townsmen found that the people of the next town over were all dead. There, dead fowlbeasts were scattered all across the ground, with their feet torn.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: No one knows why. All they know is there were a red glow and the countless corpses it left behind.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: This sounds like a horror story.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Alas, it is also nothing more than a story.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: There exists no reason, no regularity, and no explanation. No one dared to discuss it. Leithanien used to be like that.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Of course, the Empresses' rule is hardly lax either, but we at least know what we are dealing with.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: At the very least, we are not afraid to extend our greetings at balls and banquets unlike that era. We would cower underneath the throne's imposing presence and frightfully worry whether we would be so unfortunate to witness that unreasonableness firsthand.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: It's hard to imagine...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: It is indeed difficult if you haven't seen it with your own eyes.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: We don't talk about the past anymore. Now... we have a bright future ahead of us all.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: A bright future, huh?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Perhaps you are right. There is much that we can do.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I wish we'll have a pleasant partnership.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Now please excuse me.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: So this is the Hyacinth Count's exotic attendant.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: The master is eccentric, and the servant is just as crude and bold as the rumors make her.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: How insufferable...
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: The air here is still as terrible. It reeks of smoke. Well, it's much better than before, at least.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: The smell of 'progress' and 'advancement.' I'm surprised that I got used to it over the last two years...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: There are men in trendy clothes and shops everywhere. This is no different from any other city center. I'm starting to get sick of seeing this.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: What happened to the normal folks of this city? There's nothing to be appreciated in a song if the tone always stays the same.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Hmm... I guess I've made it to the outskirts?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (Hm, now that's a change of scenery.)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (If I'm not mistaken, that's...)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (What should I do...? Hm, I suppose I should contact the 'specialists'—)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (This should take care of it.)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (Is someone... following me?)
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: (Is it the guards again? No, I can't let them catch me...)
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Looks like things have calmed down.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: It should be okay now that I've come this far outside the city...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Oh? Is that right?
Hm...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Did you find them?
attributes.name: Guard A

attributes.content: No, they didn't come this way!
attributes.name: Guard B

attributes.content: Keep looking! Those Infected runaways can't be far. Come, this way!
attributes.name: Guard A

attributes.content: T-That was close...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: I didn't expect them to actually catch up...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: They are the nobles' guards. Hm, there are some traces of Arts too. Perhaps they have a Caster or two.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Um, I'm not sure who you are, but...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: No need to thank me. It was nothing.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: But it's still too early for you to lower your guard just yet. Those guys aren't that easy to shake. They will still be following you.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Going by your looks, I guess you're not from the city?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Relax. Right, it's not a bad thing to be wary of others, especially given your circumstances.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I guess... they have been chasing after you for a while?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: How long have you been Infected?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: H-How did you know?!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: N-No, I'm not infected. You're mistaken.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: I can see the crystals under your collar.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Okay, fasten up. This will do it.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Be more careful next time.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Who are you, and what do you want?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Don't worry, I'm not here to take you away or anything.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Look, if I actually wanted to do anything to you, I could get the job done with much less trouble than the men who are chasing you, and I certainly wouldn't need to stand here and talk to you.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (That's a good point...)
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Pardon me...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Oh, do you finally believe me? You're starting to sound so formal again.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Uh, I-I'm sorry!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: No need to apologize. I'm not someone who you need to be so respectful toward, either.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I've never been a fan of how the Leithanian nobles do things.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: My lady, are you—
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Drop the 'my lady' business.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: No buts.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Uh... O-Okay.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Are you not from around here...?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: I'm from Sargon. Have you heard of Sargon?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: What is it like?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: It's very, very far away. And it's a place of freedom.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: There are deserts there, as well as rainforests. Lords ameer big and small lead their own territories, and everyone there gets to live a peaceful life as long as they can pay their tribute. There are also places so remote that you can't find them on maps.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: In those places, we take care of ourselves.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I've never heard of a place like that.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: That's to be expected.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: When I first came to Leithanien, I even doubted this country existed in the same world as my homeland.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: That sounds so mysterious...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Do you find that hard to believe?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: No, it's just a little hard to imagine.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Haha, I guess it'd be hard to visualize a place when you haven't seen a it with your own eyes.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (Come to think of it... I said something similar not too long ago.)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (I have to admit. The phony noble attendant might just be right.)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Hmm? Oh... I spaced out again.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: No matter the case, this isn't a safe place to be. The guards will likely be back. We should go somewhere else before I tell you more about Sargon.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Eh? O-Okay!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Eh?! Is everything you said actually real?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Are there really rivers that flow from the sky and trees larger than whole villages?!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Of course. There's also a desert that's as tall as the mountains. Walk its golden sands, and you'll find a large hole with countless treasures buried inside...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Wow!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: I'm pulling your leg.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Eh?!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Okay, okay, don't give me that face. I wasn't really pulling your leg. It's a story I heard once. No one knows whether there's any truth to it.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Perhaps they actually have a cave full of jewels and other treasures.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I hope so...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Ah, this makes me want to go home.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Why don't you go home, then? Is it too far away?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Hm, how should I put it? I hadn't planned on staying, but I ran into some problems, and I got myself tangled up with a troublesome fellow...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I could've run off, but he definitely wouldn't be able to take care of himself, so I stayed to help him out.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I thought you said it was a troublesome person? Why are you taking care of him? Have you two become friends?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Hm, I wonder if we're friends. It's a little more complicated than that.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I'm not sure I get it...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Okay, that's for another time. Looks like the guards didn't come this way. You should be safe here for the moment, but I suggest you leave soon, just to be sure.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Umm, is it okay if I ask you another question?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Are there any Infected in Sargon?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: So they are there too...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: But they don't see the sick people as a scourge to be feared. At least not where I used to live.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: They're just sick, that's all. The beasts in the rainforest kill humans as well, and if you're out gathering fruits and ends up falling from a tree, you could hit your head and die, if you're unlucky. So what makes diseases so terrible?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: That's wonderful...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: It's not all smiles and sugar cubes. Life there is tough in most places. It's because of how tough it is that we don't worry about it so much.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: What about you? Does the lord here send guards after anyone who's infected?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: We didn't used to be like this...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: My parents worked the mines, and we lived in the area closest to the mining district. A lot of people there have gotten sick.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: All the older folks who work the mines get this disease in the end. Rocks begin to grow on their bodies, but they still have to keep working.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Anyone who has just a bit more money wouldn't ever set foot on our street. Anyone who's not sick yet tries to move out of the area...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: It sounds almost like a quarantine zone.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: A little, but I heard you have to pay to move into the better quarantine zones. They even hand out bread there. That's something that we can only dream of.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: But at least we can live there.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Live how? A mine worker, like your parents, would never step outside your district?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: That isn't so bad... We have a roof over our heads, and we make a small living. That's more than enough to me.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: At least that's what I used to think.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: But then the mines collapsed. My parents didn't come back. The guards sealed off the streets and started rounding up everyone they saw.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: And then no one dared to go outside anymore. Everyone stayed inside, but the guards would also go door to door and force their way in... What have we done wrong?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: (So this is them dealing with it 'accordingly'...)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: A few kids and I sneaked out of a back alley behind an abandoned building while the guards were distracted. I know the men outside think that anyone who's sick has to die, but I don't want to die!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: I... I'm scared...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: There, there... Don't cry. Where are the kids you escaped with?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: We made it to this area a couple days ago. There wasn't anywhere we could hide as a group, so we decided to split up.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: That was the last time I saw them, and now I'm all alone...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: I... I need to find them!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Calm down, let me—
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Shh, quiet down.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: This way!
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: Looks like someone has been here...
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: (Calm down. Don't look at him. Breathe slowly...)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (Good girl.)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (Wait for me here.)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Finally showing yourself, my lady?
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: I'm not one to keep my guests waiting when they come visit with such sincerity.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: You're alone. Where are the guards?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: They needn't be here.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: You sound very confident.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Lady of Sargon, why are you protecting an Infected?
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: No special reason. I met her, and I thought I'd give her a helping hand.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: And what are you after?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: If the goal was simply to be rid of the Infected, they wouldn't need a Caster such as yourself to go through the trouble. You have been capturing the miners for the past two days. What exactly are your orders?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Are you investigating us?
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: Nothing so serious. I'm only doing a cursory investigation before we actually sign the contract.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I wouldn't have figured this out, but I had a little enlightenment earlier today, so I have a good idea of how much Sir Feuerbach has covered up, using you and his guards. Should I perhaps share this with everyone here right now?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: You're quiet. Why so shy? I saw the slaves you were leading away while you were casting. They are Infected, no?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Looks like the dark memories that the Witch King left behind are not merely a thing of the past. Those cruel Arts are still being studied...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Is that what you're capturing the Infected for?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: You're a quiet one. Looks like I found the wrong person to strike a conversation.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: We needn't share a conversation.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: I am merely greeting an Arts user, out of courtesy.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: Would you like to get down to business, then? Personally, I prefer to stay out of trouble, but who am I to refuse an opportunity to witness an esteemed Leithanian Caster's skills firsthand?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (What... are they talking about?!)
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: (Slaves... and research? Is that what they are doing with all the people they caught...?)
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: We have no intention of making an enemy of Count Hohenlohe...
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: Lady of Sargon, I've heard rumors about you. Your Originium Arts are formidable.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: I guess I should say thanks?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: No need.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: I've never understood you people.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I see in Leithanien an expanding, overbearing authority. At the same time, I see everyone here worshipping that authority. I've never come to understand why in my two years here.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: You haven't been breathing the air here.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: It's a bit too smoggy for my taste.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: In that case, you will suffocate. It is the fate of all those who breathe foreign air.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: You make that sound like some kind of curse.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: If you wish to die to strange witchcraft, I suggest you try a Sarkaz, of an ancient bloodline.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: It's not part of our plan to fight you here... You may have the Infected hiding there.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: Oh, that's music to my ears. Here I was racking my brain thinking how to keep your screams down... I wouldn't want this to cause any problems in our partnership.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Hmph, arrogant foreigner. I can overlook this, but do not forget...
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: Leithanien has its own rules, and the rules here do not bend to any one person.
attributes.name: Leithanian Caster

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: He's gone. I'm so glad we didn't actually end up fighting. I wouldn't want to ruin anything and get my ears pinned back by the little Count.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: It's okay. You can come out—
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Hm? Why are you so quiet? Did that scare you?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Look at what a crybaby you are... You are so much more timid than my little sister.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: I'm not scared...!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: It's just... I heard what you two just said...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: What will happen to everyone they took away?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Do you want me to lie to make you feel better?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Okay. If you want to hear the truth, I guess all I can tell you is things aren't looking great for them.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: The nobles here want to make everything here 'go away.' That's both the accident in the mine and the workers there. Whether they were caught by the Casters or the guards, things don't bode well for them.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: This is what you wanted to know.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Why...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Oh, don't cry. I'm not good around girls your age, crying their eyes out.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: What will you do now? Are you going to look for your friends?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: R-Right! I shouldn't cry yet. I need to find the others...!
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: If... If the nobles here won't have us, we'll leave this place behind... and go somewhere else! I'm older than all of them. I'm the big sister. I need to protect them...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: And... one day... I'll avenge the people in the neighborhood...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: You'll leave this place? Even if you have to leave your homeland?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Even if I... have to leave everything behind.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: I don't have much left anyway.
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: You're right about that...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Okay, if that's how you feel, there's someone much better suited for the task than me.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: You can come on out too. Enough hiding, my 'specialist.'
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Sheesh... You make that sound like I meant to hide. Can't you let me make a decent entrance?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: My bad, but your footsteps were pretty loud. Asking me to pretend I didn't hear that just to give you a nice entrance is a pretty tall order.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Maybe that says something about what big ears you got, then.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I'll take that as a compliment.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: That's not a... Whatever.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I-Is this person... a specialist?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Don't listen to her. My job is nothing that glamorous. I'm just a—
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Aren't you guys specialists that handle Infected problems? That's how you introduced yourselves, if I remember correctly.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Don't forget you are one of us.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Ah... Yeah, I know.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (So half-hearted!)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Hey, now. Don't make a fuss about everything. Anyway, everything's as you can see. Can I leave the girl to you people?)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (Well, no problem with that.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Considering your standing... It's not a good idea to bring her with you.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (My, how dependable.)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (Stop playing with me already. That's another girl putting on the weeps because of you. How many times has it been?)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (I really don't get it. You keep saying you can't stir up any trouble, but you keep running into trouble head on every time.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Haha, I wonder why. I'm not so sure.)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: (I'm just doing things according to my principles...)
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Excuse me...
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Will we... meet again?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: As long as you stay true to your beliefs now, I'm sure we will.
attributes.name: Carnelian

attributes.content: Those who are humble will always say, 'This is where I belong.'
Those who are egotistical will say, 'This place belongs to me.'
Life in Sargon is shaped by the shifting sands. Here stands a woman of Sargon who is certainly not an egotist, but definitely not humble either.
If you must change who you are to fit in, there is no need.
You needn't fit in.
Be yourself.
